private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labelled with vowels: I, O, A, E
I can only move the top block of a stack and only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks to achieve the target stacked configuration where A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O on the table

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labelled with consonants: C, G, M, B, K, H, F, N, J, D, L
I can only move the top block of a stack and only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks to achieve the target stacked configuration where A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O on the table

orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem that coordinates the two agents to reach the target stacked configuration, compatible with the FastDownward solver

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labelled blocks: I, C, G, M, B, K, H, F, O, A, N, E, J, D, L
Initial arrangement: I is on the table
Initial arrangement: C is on the table
Initial arrangement: G is on top of C
Initial arrangement: M is on top of I
Initial arrangement: B is on the table
Initial arrangement: K is on top of M
Initial arrangement: H is on top of B
Initial arrangement: F is on top of K
Initial arrangement: O is on top of H
Initial arrangement: A is on the table
Initial arrangement: N is on top of O
Initial arrangement: E is on top of G
Initial arrangement: J is on top of A
Initial arrangement: D is on top of J
Initial arrangement: L is on top of E
Goal arrangement: A is on top of B
Goal arrangement: B is on top of C
Goal arrangement: C is on top of D
Goal arrangement: D is on top of E
Goal arrangement: E is on top of F
Goal arrangement: F is on top of G
Goal arrangement: G is on top of H
Goal arrangement: H is on top of I
Goal arrangement: I is on top of J
Goal arrangement: J is on top of K
Goal arrangement: K is on top of L
Goal arrangement: L is on top of M
Goal arrangement: M is on top of N
Goal arrangement: N is on top of O
Goal arrangement: O is on the table
Both agents can only move the top block of any stack
Both agents can only move one block at a time
One agent may operate only on vowel-labelled blocks and the other only on consonant-labelled blocks

pddl.system_prompt: You are the vowel-focused manipulator agent. You cannot produce the final PDDL yourself. Instead, provide a clear, structured perspective describing what you can observe and which top-of-stack moves you can perform given the public information and your private capabilities. List the vowel blocks that are currently accessible at the top of stacks and any constraints or uncertainties you see.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Use the public information to list which vowel-labelled blocks are present and which of those are currently at the top of stacks and thus movable by you. Also explain any blocking relationships you observe that will require other agents to move consonant blocks first. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise set of allowed move types you can perform and any recommendations for sequencing that involve vowel moves. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}

pddl.system_prompt: You are the consonant-focused manipulator agent. You cannot produce the final PDDL yourself. Instead, provide a clear, structured perspective describing what you can observe and which top-of-stack moves you can perform given the public information and your private capabilities. List the consonant blocks that are currently accessible at the top of stacks and any constraints or uncertainties you see.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Use the public information to list which consonant-labelled blocks are present and which of those are currently at the top of stacks and thus movable by you. Also explain any blocking relationships you observe that will require the vowel agent to move vowel blocks first. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise set of allowed move types you can perform and any recommendations for sequencing that involve consonant moves. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning. Your role is to take the observations and capabilities reported by the two agents and produce a single, coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that is compatible with the FastDownward planner. The domain must keep the agents' actions distinct and encode that vowel moves can only be performed by the vowel agent and consonant moves only by the consonant agent. Provide the PDDL domain and problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is syntactically compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the observations from the vowel agent and the consonant agent and must integrate them into a single PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global stacking goal. Keep agent actions separate in the domain so FastDownward can reason about which agent can perform which actions. Use the following inputs from the agents to resolve partial information and blocking relationships: {vowel_agent_obs} {consonant_agent_obs} Also consider the public environment facts: {environment->public_information} Your output must be a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Output the final PDDL only; do not include other analysis or commentary.
